boardgame.description: This is a semi-cooperative game which puts the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;thief_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; against the rest of the players, who take the role of detectives. As the thief, you secretly plot your movements around a private art museum. As you go, the detectives take turns trying to find you with their eyes, the video cameras, or motion detectors. You can deactivate the cameras, and you can even cut off the power to the entire museum to mask your movements. Another advantage is that the thief gets a turn after every detective's individual turn._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Another problem for the detectives is the fact that, once the thief has picked up a painting, she can take her next turn before removing the painting from the gameboard. The good guys know the vicinity, but won't know her exact location, as the thief is now up to 3 squares away from that spot. If a detective ever spots you with the naked eye, secret movement is over, and the thief's token is placed on the board for all to see. This can get frantic, since the thief can only move 1-3 spaces, while detectives roll a d6 for movement!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The thief player has to decide when to attempt a getaway. The catch is, some of the windows and doors are locked. There are actual lock pieces, and you must flip over the one you are attempting to open (instant detective frenzy!). If she has stolen 3 paintings (in a one-off game), and manages to get out, she wins. In a tournament style game, each player gets a turn at being the thief, so the number of paintings needed will vary based on the other players' scores._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;1991 Mensa Select_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Also selected by Family Fun Magazine as one of the best games._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Original name by inventors was Heist. Clue name was added for marketing purposes when the game was licensed with Parker Brothers._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Similar to_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Scotland Yard_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The Fury of Dracula_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Specter Ops_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: CLUE THE GREAT MUSEUM CAPER 1991 Parker Brothers. Complete with rules (english, spanish), 3D gameboard, 2 special dice, thief standup shield, thief plotting pad with over 35 sheets, 6 video cameras, 7 pawns, 9 paintings, 9 painting stands, 11 locks. Looks like it was played once, then put away. All pieces are in like-new condition. Box is solid with minor wear and no split corners. Shipping weight is 4 pounds.

Game is complete. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Thief shield_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; and _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;painting_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; show a bit of wear. Thief pad is nearly full. Box is a bit caved on top, but no split corners. 3-D game board and other parts are in very good condition. Rules are included in English and Spanish.

Complete and in good shape. Pictures available upon request. Note that due to the large size of this game, I will likely have to buy a box to ship it in, which will add approximately $4 to the shipping cost.

Components are punched and stickered but look unused. Box has very slight shelfwear and damage. Note pad is unused.

This 1991 hard-to-find, 3-dimentional game by Parker Brothers is one we enjoyed . The thief who steals the most paintings wins while the game characters and cameras try to catch the thief. Contents are complete, clean _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; undamaged. The box is solid but does have dings _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; dents, a small amount of remaining tape and shelf wear.
Complete and good shape. Complete and bagged. Shows some shelf wear, but otherwise in very good shape. This game is oversized, so $12 for shipping in the US is a bargain.
Game box is in fine shape, Game is complete except for the thief cardboard shield. Even inlucdes over 40 sheets on the pad. After you make your own cardboard shield, you are ready to go.
Box has shelwear but the contents are great. Long out of print and a fun cat _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; mouse type game with a cool 3D board.

Up for your review is a board game by Parker Brothers, 1991 - Clue, The Museum Caper - COMPLETE. Outer Box is in good condition with (1) taped corner and minor shelf wear (numerous age spots). There is a small puncture just above _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;miss white_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; head (about .75_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; in diameter) and a small bit of price tag residue on bottom side of lid (about 1_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; in length).(see picture_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s for more detail). Interior contents are in very good condition with only minimal signs of use. Of note: on the game board (1) of the museum outdoor _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;signs_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; has a torn decal - does not affect gameplay in any way, but needs mentioned. Bottom box likewise has numerous _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;age spots_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; and a couple of creases in the corners (longest being about 6_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;) not uncommon with boxes of this size. See actual item photos below for further detail. This game will weigh around 4.25 pounds once it has been packaged for shipping. I will combine multiple purchases being shipped to the same address. Feel free to pm me with any questions you may have in regard to the game listed above. Errors: I try to be as accurate in item description as possible however, I may miss or overlook something with the game listed above. Any oversight is purely accidental and not meant to defraud the buyer in anyway. I will try to work out those errors when possible and I do accept returned items as a last resort (with full payment refunded, minus BGG fees), however postage for the returned item is the buyers responsibility. All items are sold _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;as-is_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. Payment: For domestic orders (US) I prefer payment through money order or check but will also accept paypal if need be. For international orders I prefer payment to be made through paypal. I will email you once payment has been received and again once your item has shipped (with delivery confirmation). Shipping: Shipping will be actual charges plus $1.85 (for packing _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; delivery conformation). Insurance is optional but recommended. If I do end up overcharging I will simply upgrade to the next shipping rate (i.e. parcel post _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; priority). I always ship items with delivery confirmation. About Me: I have been a member of BGG for several years but have done all my selling of vintage and OOP board games on Ebay. Since last year (march ‘08) when their site went through radical modifications it became too expensive and risky in my estimation to continue business through their site. You can look up my user id: junkfield - by going to the community page on their website and read over my 100% positive feedbacks. I appreciate your interest in this game and look forward to selling through BGG. Thanks, Jon

Clue The Great Museum Caper Complete No Handling Fee This game is complete. Contains the following in very good condition: 3-D gameboard 6 video camera markers 11 locks 9 miniature paintings and plastic bases One thief shield One thief plotting pad One thief pawn (gray) 6 clue character pawns (white, purple, yellow, green, blue, red) 2 special dice Rules in English and Spanish Labels have been applied to cameras and locks Box is intact, no split corners, but does have scratches, small dings and slight dishing (concavity on box lid). Also clear tape remnants and a small (one inch) spot on the lid above Colonel Mustard’s head that looks as if something wet was spilled and allowed to dry. This does not affect the game or the pieces. 3 Buyer pays postage on three pounds shipping weight from my zip of 98338. There is no handling fee. I will ship world-wide.

CLUE ® THE GREAT MUSEUM CAPER GAME _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; A 3-D Art Theft Mystery -- in the Classic CLUE® Tradition _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; # Parker Brothers # © 1991 Waddingtons Games Ltd. # For 2-4 Players # Ages 10 and Up _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s a perfect night for a robbery -- and you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re the Thief ! _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Join Colonel Mustard and all your favorite CLUE® game characters as they try to catch the thief who_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s broken into Mr. Boddy_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s private art museum and is snatching priceless paintings from under their very noses ! _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; In this 3-D game of detection and evasion, one of you will play the invisible Thief and make all your moves in secret behind the Thief_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Shield. The other players will work together to sniff your whereabouts, lay chase, and prevent your getaway ! _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; You_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll take turns being the invisible Thief, marking all your moves on the Thief Plotting Pad and sneaking around the museum - completely hidden from the other players ! _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Can Camera No. 6 see you ? _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Players roll the special Eye, Video Camera and Motion Detector die and track the Thief within the walls of the 3-D museum game board. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; But the cagey culprit can disconnect cameras, snip wires, even shut down the entire security system - and, one by one, snatch the priceless paintings during this daring art heist ! _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Which character will be the one to catch you ? Or will you make your escape and slip into the night with all your loot ? _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Whoever wins, CLUE® THE GREAT MUSEUM CAPERâ?¢ game is sure to be the greatest heist in history ! _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; The game is complete including the instructions. The contents are in very good condition with minor wear to the cardboard thief shield . There are still several unused Thief Plotting pad sheets. The box has some normal wear. The price is: $ 23.00 plus the shipping cost _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; handling fee listed below: The shipping and handling cost on this game to locations in the Contiguous US 48 states is $ 12.00 to be added to the cost of the game. Add any other game from our online store (when ordered within 24 hours of this game) (which do not have a greater shipping and handling cost) for an additional shipping and handling cost of only $ 3.00 per game plus, obviously, the cost of the game or games. :-) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Prepay sale. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Ohio residents: please add 7.75% Ohio sales tax. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; We ONLY ship via UPS Ground. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; We accept payment by personal, business and cashiers checks and money orders, PayPal and Google Checkout. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Payment must be in U.S. funds and drawn on a U.S. bank. PayPal and Google Checkout is accepted from Contiguous U.S. 48 states residents ONLY. Items MUST be shipped to a UPS deliverable address in the Contiguous U.S. 48 states. NO Post Office Boxes, NO APO/FPO _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Sorry but all sales are final and no returns are permitted. ==_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Contiguous U.S. 48 states ONLY. ==_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Sorry but NO INTERNATIONAL SALES Sorry but no sales to Alaska _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Hawaii. ==_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; IF you are from a destination outside the Contiguous US 48 states and you wish to purchase this item, you may do so ONLY IF you have a friend, relative or company in the Contiguous US 48 states who can receive the UPS shipment FOR YOU. ==_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; We apologize for these selling exclusions but the UPS shipping cost to the excluded regions makes it quite cost prohibitive.
